segments.en: Hello, everyone.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And my name is Katherine.
And today, Marco, we're talking about something that I know you're a big fan of.
segments.cn: 今天，Marco，我们要谈论一些我知道你非常喜欢的东西。

segments.en: I am.
We're talking about computer games, video games.
segments.cn: 我们要谈论电脑游戏和视频游戏。

segments.en: Woohoo!
Woohoo!
So yeah, we're going to be looking at some vocabulary and phrases related to computer games and video games.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我们将查看一些与电脑游戏和视频游戏相关的词汇和短语。

segments.en: And this is actually a request from one of our users.
segments.cn: 这实际上是我们用户的请求。

segments.en: Awesome.
So, before we get started, we do have the name of the game that we're going to look at.
segments.cn: 在开始之前，我们确实有我们要查看的游戏名称。

segments.en: So let's listen to that in today's vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 所以让我们在今天的词汇预览中听一下。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview.
Alright, so the game that we're going to preview today is called Counter-Strike.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们要预览的游戏叫做反恐精英。

segments.en: Okay, so first you have a strike, or an attack, and then you have a counter-strike.
segments.cn: 好的，首先你有一次攻击，然后你有一次反击。

segments.en: So that's an opposite attack or something like that, right?
segments.cn: 所以这是一个相反的攻击，对吧？

segments.en: So it's a reaction to the first thing that happens.
segments.cn: 这是对第一次发生的事情的反应。

segments.en: So you hit me and my counter-strike is I hit you back.
segments.cn: 所以你打了我，我的反击是我打你。

segments.en: And this game is actually very, very popular all over the world because many players are able to compete at the same time.
segments.cn: 这个游戏在全世界都非常受欢迎，因为许多玩家可以同时竞争。

segments.en: So it's a shooting game, you shoot each other.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个射击游戏，你们互相射击。

segments.en: You are the terrorist and then the other team is like the police or the army or whatever.
segments.cn: 你是恐怖分子，另一队就像警察或军队。

segments.en: Wow, sounds really exciting.
Well, we're going to learn more about the specific vocab that goes with computer games and video games in a minute.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们马上就会学习与电脑游戏和视频游戏相关的具体词汇。

segments.en: But first, let's take a listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 但首先，让我们听一下我们的对话。

segments.en: Mark, where have you been?
I've been calling you all morning.
segments.cn: 我整个早上都在打电话给你。

segments.en: I've been playing computer games.
What?
So you blew me off yesterday and today over a stupid video game.
segments.cn: 所以你昨天和今天都因为一个愚蠢的视频游戏而不理我。

segments.en: What game is so important that you have no time for me anymore?
segments.cn: 什么游戏这么重要，以至于你没有时间陪我？

segments.en: What are you playing?
It's called Counter-Strike.
It's a first-person shooter game.
segments.cn: 这是一个第一人称射击游戏。

segments.en: It's awesome!
It's a multi-player game where you can go online and compete against players from all over the world.
segments.cn: 这是一个多人游戏，你可以在线与来自世界各地的玩家竞争。

segments.en: You've been wasting your time on this?
segments.cn: 你在浪费时间在这个上面？

segments.en: I can't believe it.
It doesn't even look fun or challenging.
segments.cn: 这看起来一点都不有趣或具有挑战性。

segments.en: My laptop is on my bed.
segments.cn: 我的笔记本电脑在我的床上。

segments.en: If you think it's so easy, then get online and try to beat me.
segments.cn: 如果你觉得这么简单，那就上网试着打败我。

segments.en: Damn it!
How are you killing me with a single shot?
segments.cn: 你怎么能一枪就杀了我？

segments.en: It's not fair!
I don't want to play anymore!
Let's go get something to eat.
Can you bring me something?
I'm totally hooked on this game.
segments.cn: 我完全沉迷于这个游戏。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
So there was some really interesting vocab here.
segments.cn: 这里有一些非常有趣的词汇。

segments.en: So let's look at it now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在语言收获中看看。

segments.en: Okay, so what kind of a game was this, Marco?
segments.cn: 好的，这个游戏是什么类型的，Marco？

segments.en: Alright, this game was a FPS or also in the dialogue we heard a first-person shooter game.
segments.cn: 好的，这个游戏是一个FPS，或者在对话中我们听到的第一人称射击游戏。

segments.en: So our users might have heard this phrase first-person before because it's a grammar term in many ways.
segments.cn: 我们的用户可能之前听过这个短语第一人称，因为在很多方面它是一个语法术语。

segments.en: We talk about I.
I do this.
I can sing.
That's the first person.
But when we're talking about games, first-person shooter means that what you do, you're doing as if you were the character in the game.
segments.cn: 但当我们谈论游戏时，第一人称射击意味着你所做的事情，就像你是游戏中的角色一样。

segments.en: Right, so even the way that you're looking at the game, it seems like you're looking through the eyes of the character.
segments.cn: 对，所以即使你看游戏的方式，似乎你是通过角色的眼睛在看。

segments.en: Okay, so you don't see the body.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你看不到身体。

segments.en: You are the body of the person.
So first-person shooter.
So shooter obviously means that this is a shooting game.
segments.cn: 所以射击显然意味着这是一个射击游戏。

segments.en: What you do is you pull the trigger and shoot people.
segments.cn: 你所做的就是扣动扳机射击人。

segments.en: And as we mentioned, a lot of players are able to compete against each other.
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，很多玩家能够相互竞争。

segments.en: So it's called a multiplayer game.
So multi is a prefix.
It goes at the beginning of a word.
In English that means many.
segments.cn: 在英语中，这意味着许多。

segments.en: So you could hear multicolored or multiethnic.
segments.cn: 所以你可能会听到多色或多民族。

segments.en: And the meaning of this is that there are many different colors or many different ethnicities.
segments.cn: 这意味着有许多不同的颜色或许多不同的民族。

segments.en: Or in this case, multiplayer, many different players at the same time.
segments.cn: 或者在这种情况下，多人游戏，许多不同的玩家同时。

segments.en: Exactly, so in this game many players can play whether it's in a local area network or online over the Internet.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以在这个游戏中，许多玩家可以玩，无论是在局域网还是在线通过互联网。

segments.en: Cool, so you actually have to have the Internet right when you're doing this because you're using many different computers so they have to be connected to each other.
segments.cn: 酷，所以你实际上必须在做这个的时候有互联网，因为你使用许多不同的计算机，所以它们必须相互连接。

segments.en: Right, and that's our next word.
segments.cn: 对，这就是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: You go online in order to play.
Okay, so online you've heard before.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你之前听过在线。

segments.en: Online means on the Internet.
segments.cn: 在线意味着在互联网上。

segments.en: But in this case, the action of using the Internet is called going online.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，使用互联网的行为称为上网。

segments.en: So I want to go online to read my email.
segments.cn: 所以我想上网查看我的电子邮件。

segments.en: Right, or I can't go online.
I don't have a connection.
My mom won't let me go online.
I'm in trouble.
Alright, so this is the way that you use it.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是你使用它的方式。

segments.en: You go online.
In order to use the Internet, you go online.
segments.cn: 为了使用互联网，你上网。

segments.en: Very interesting.
Well, the last word we've got here in language takeaway is a very important one when we talk about video games because many people are in this situation.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在语言收获中最后一个词是一个非常重要的词，当我们谈论视频游戏时，因为许多人处于这种情况。

segments.en: They're hooked on video games.
Right, so if you are hooked on a video game or you are hooked on anything it means you're kind of addicted or you're very, very interested in something.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你沉迷于一个视频游戏或任何东西，这意味着你有点上瘾或对某事非常感兴趣。

segments.en: Exactly, so I'm hooked on the TV show True Blood.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以我沉迷于电视剧《真血》。

segments.en: I love to watch it and I love... Every day I run home so I can watch it.
segments.cn: 我喜欢看它，我每天都跑回家看。

segments.en: But is there a game that you're hooked on, Marco?
segments.cn: 但Marco，你有沉迷于的游戏吗？

segments.en: Currently, I am hooked on a game called Guitar Hero Metallica.
segments.cn: 目前，我沉迷于一个叫做《吉他英雄：金属乐队》的游戏。

segments.en: Ooh, fun.
Yeah, it's really fun.
When I borrowed your PS3, I was hooked on Bad Company.
segments.cn: 当我借用你的PS3时，我沉迷于《坏公司》。

segments.en: They're great games.
It's very easy to get hooked on video games.
segments.cn: 很容易就会迷上视频游戏。

segments.en: Too easy.
Alright, so that's all the words we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们要分享的语言内容。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue again and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Mark, where have you been?
I've been calling you all morning.
segments.cn: 我今天早上一直在打电话给你。

segments.en: I've been playing computer games.
What?
So you blew me off yesterday and today over a stupid video game.
segments.cn: 所以你昨天和今天都因为一个愚蠢的视频游戏而不理我。

segments.en: What game is so important that you have no time for me anymore?
segments.cn: 什么游戏重要到你没有时间理我？

segments.en: What are you playing?
It's called Counter-Strike.
It's a first-person shooter game.
segments.cn: 这是一款第一人称射击游戏。

segments.en: It's awesome!
It's a multiplayer game where you can go online and compete against players from all over the world.
segments.cn: 这是一个多人游戏，你可以在线与来自世界各地的玩家竞争。

segments.en: You've been wasting your time on this?
I can't believe it.
It doesn't even look fun or challenging.
segments.cn: 这看起来一点都不有趣或具有挑战性。

segments.en: My laptop is on my bed.
segments.cn: 我的笔记本电脑在床上。

segments.en: If you think it's so easy, then get online and try to beat me.
segments.cn: 如果你觉得这么简单，那就上网试着打败我。

segments.en: Fine.
Damn it!
How are you killing me with a single shot?
segments.cn: 你怎么能一枪就杀了我？

segments.en: It's not fair!
I don't want to play anymore.
Let's go get something to eat.
Can you bring me something?
I'm totally hooked on this game.
segments.cn: 我完全迷上了这个游戏。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
And we have a couple of phrases that we want to look at.
segments.cn: 我们有几个短语想要讨论。

segments.en: Specifically two phrases.
So let's look at those now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在流利度构建器中看看这些。

segments.en: Fluency Builder So what's the deal?
segments.cn: 流利度构建器 那么，怎么回事？

segments.en: You blew me off yesterday and now you're not even going to say sorry?
segments.cn: 你昨天不理我，现在连个对不起都不说？

segments.en: Alright, so blew me off.
What do you mean when you say you blew me off yesterday?
segments.cn: 你说你昨天不理我是什么意思？

segments.en: Okay, so let's take a look at the infinitive version of this phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看这个短语的动词不定式版本。

segments.en: So to blow someone off.
And they all go together.
It's a fixed phrase.
And this means to have an appointment with someone, but to not go.
segments.cn: 这意味着和某人有约，但不去。

segments.en: So we had a date planned, but he blew me off.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一个约会，但他放了我鸽子。

segments.en: Okay.
What a jerk.
He didn't go.
I went.
Did he tell you that he wasn't going to go?
No.
Okay.
No, so it's a surprise.
It's like you expect someone to come meet you or do something with you, but they don't say anything and they don't go.
segments.cn: 就像你期待某人来见你或和你做某事，但他们什么都不说，也不去。

segments.en: So there's another word very similar to this one and it's to stand someone up, right?
segments.cn: 所以还有一个与这个非常相似的词，就是“放你鸽子”，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
So he stood me up.
He didn't come.
He blew me off.
Okay.
Very good.
Alright, and what's our next phrase?
segments.cn: 好的，下一个短语是什么？

segments.en: To waste your time.
Alright, so the girlfriend in this case was like, you're wasting your time on these video games.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在这种情况下，女朋友说，你在这些视频游戏上浪费时间。

segments.en: That means you're not getting anything out of this.
segments.cn: 这意味着你没有从中获得任何东西。

segments.en: You're not benefiting.
It means that you could spend your time doing other things.
segments.cn: 这意味着你可以把时间花在其他事情上。

segments.en: Okay.
So if you're wasting your time on video games, you're not being productive.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在玩视频游戏上浪费时间，你就没有生产力。

segments.en: Exactly.
You're not learning anything.
So your mother might say to you when you're a kid, don't waste your time on games.
segments.cn: 所以你妈妈可能会在你小时候对你说，不要在游戏上浪费时间。

segments.en: You should be studying.
Okay.
Or he wastes a lot of time watching TV.
segments.cn: 或者他浪费了很多时间看电视。

segments.en: That's a common problem.
Alright.
So let's listen to this dialogue again real fast and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 那么我们再快速听一遍这个对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Terrorists win.
Mark, where have you been?
I've been calling you all morning.
segments.cn: 我今天早上一直在打电话给你。

segments.en: I've been playing computer games.
What?
So you blew me off yesterday and today over a stupid video game.
segments.cn: 所以你昨天和今天都因为一个愚蠢的视频游戏而不理我。

segments.en: What game is so important that you have no time for me anymore?
segments.cn: 什么游戏重要到你没有时间理我？

segments.en: What are you playing?
It's called Counter Strike.
It's a first person shooter game.
segments.cn: 这是一款第一人称射击游戏。

segments.en: It's awesome!
It's a multiplayer game where you can go online and compete against players from all over the world.
segments.cn: 这是一个多人游戏，你可以在线与来自世界各地的玩家竞争。

segments.en: You've been wasting your time on this?
I can't believe it.
It doesn't even look fun or challenging.
segments.cn: 这看起来一点都不有趣或具有挑战性。

segments.en: My laptop is on my bed.
segments.cn: 我的笔记本电脑在床上。

segments.en: If you think it's so easy then get online and try to beat me.
segments.cn: 如果你觉得这么简单，那就上网试着打败我。

segments.en: Fine.
Damn it!
How are you killing me with a single shot?
segments.cn: 你怎么能一枪就杀了我？

segments.en: It's not fair.
I don't want to play anymore.
Let's go get something to eat.
Can you bring me something?
I'm totally hooked on this game.
segments.cn: 我完全沉迷于这个游戏。

segments.en: Alright, so we talked about, you know, being hooked on TV shows and video games.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们谈到了沉迷于电视节目和视频游戏。

segments.en: But this is actually a very big problem in some Asian countries specifically, right?
segments.cn: 但这在一些亚洲国家确实是个大问题，对吧？

segments.en: I've heard that.
Actually I've heard that in Japan, Korea and China specifically there are psychological treatment centers for kids who are addicted to gaming.
segments.cn: 其实我听说在日本、韩国和中国，专门有心理治疗中心帮助沉迷于游戏的孩子。

segments.en: And so there's a big thing in the news in China recently where there were parents who were sending their kids to this treatment center.
segments.cn: 最近中国的新闻中有个大事件，父母把孩子送到这个治疗中心。

segments.en: Rehab.
Rehab for games.
And that actually they found out that the rehab center didn't know what they were doing and they were giving the kids electroshock therapy to get them off games.
segments.cn: 他们发现康复中心根本不知道自己在做什么，还给孩子们进行电击治疗来让他们戒掉游戏。

segments.en: Wow, really?
So the parents took their kids back.
segments.cn: 所以父母把孩子带回来了。

segments.en: That's scary.
It is scary.
I guess it's a very popular thing in Asian countries specifically, right?
segments.cn: 我想这在亚洲国家确实很流行，对吧？

segments.en: To play online, to go online.
There's a lot of other factors that influence this.
segments.cn: 还有很多其他因素影响着这一点。

segments.en: But I think it is, like everything in excess is dangerous.
segments.cn: 但我认为，过度的事情都是危险的。

segments.en: This is true.
And actually some people have been using this addiction to be a productive use of their time.
segments.cn: 其实有些人利用这种上瘾来有效利用他们的时间。

segments.en: So you have some people who play a game called World of Warcraft.
segments.cn: 所以有些人玩一个叫《魔兽世界》的游戏。

segments.en: And they win money.
And they win money and they sell things to other players all over the world.
segments.cn: 他们赢得了钱，并且把东西卖给世界各地的其他玩家。

segments.en: And so you have these kids in America buying toys and like shields and gold from kids in, for example, Indonesia.
segments.cn: 所以你有这些美国的孩子从印尼的孩子那里买玩具、盾牌和金币。

segments.en: And the kid in Indonesia is making money.
Right, right, right.
And also, if they're really good, they go on to become professional gamers.
segments.cn: 如果他们真的很优秀，他们会成为职业玩家。

segments.en: And compete in world competitions and also test out new video games.
segments.cn: 参加世界比赛，还测试新的视频游戏。

segments.en: So yeah, it has its advantages as well.
segments.cn: 所以，是的，这也有它的优势。

segments.en: Can you imagine what your business card would look like?
segments.cn: 你能想象你的名片会是什么样子吗？

segments.en: Professional gamer.
Professional gamer.
Alright, that's all the time we have for today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的时间就到这里。

segments.en: We hope you enjoyed this lesson.
And of course, if you have any questions, comments or doubts, please come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你有任何问题、评论或疑虑，请访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And we'll see you guys there.
Until next time, everyone.
Bye.
You.
